name: 04B-Forecasting-Using-SARIMAX
parameters: --var getStarted=true --var selectOrg=1 --var selectProduct='AutoCAD','Maya','3ds Max','Revit','Fusion 360' --var exploreData=false --var orgChange=false --var selectTimeseriesModel=1 --var trainModel1=true --var selectOrg=2 --var selectModelForForecasting=1 --var enterThePeriodForForecasting=12 --var forecast1=true --var selectModelForForecasting=0 --var forecast2=true

nodes.name: Read CSV
nodes.description: It reads in CSV files and creates a DataFrame from it.
nodes.hint: Refresh the schema when a new file is selected or the file content has changed

fields.title: Drop Special Character In ColumnName
fields.description: Whether to drop the Special Characters and Spaces in Column Name.

fields.title: Mode
fields.description: Mode for dealing with corrupt records during parsing.

fields.name: enforceSchema
fields.title: Enforce Schema
fields.description: If it is set to true, the specified or inferred schema will be forcibly applied to datasource files, and headers in CSV files will be ignored. If the option is set to false, the schema will be validated against all headers in CSV files in the case when the header option is set to true.

fields.title: Whether to Add Input File Name as Column in the Dataframe

fields.description: Decodes the CSV files by the given encoding type

fields.name: quote
fields.title: Quote
fields.description: Sets a single character used for escaping quoted values where the separator can be part of the value

fields.name: escape
fields.title: Escape
fields.description: Sets a single character used for escaping quotes inside an already quoted value.

fields.description: Whether to replace existing columns or create new ones?

nodes.name: Sarimax
nodes.description: Seasonal Autoregressive Integrated Moving Average, SARIMA or Seasonal ARIMA, is an extension of ARIMA that explicitly supports univariate time series data with a seasonal component.

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: endog
fields.title: Endog Column
fields.description: The observed time-series process Eg:col1

fields.name: exogenous
fields.title: Exogenous Columns
fields.description: An optional 2-d array of exogenous variables. If provided, these variables are used as additional features in the regression operation. This should not include a constant or trend.

fields.name: order
fields.title: Order
fields.description: The (p,d,q) order of the model for the number of AR parameters, differences, and MA parameters. d must be an integer indicating the integration order of the process, while p and q may either be an integers indicating the AR and MA orders (so that all lags up to those orders are included) or else iterables giving specific AR and or MA lags to include. Default is an AR(1) model: (1,0,0)

fields.name: seasonal_order
fields.title: Seasonal Order
fields.description: The (P,D,Q,s) order of the seasonal component of the model for the AR parameters, differences, MA parameters, and periodicity. D must be an integer indicating the integration order of the process, while P and Q may either be an integers indicating the AR and MA orders (so that all lags up to those orders are included) or else iterables giving specific AR and / or MA lags to include.s is an integer giving the periodicity (number of periods in season), often it is 4 for quarterly data or 12 for monthly data. Default is no seasonal effect.

fields.name: trend
fields.title: Trend
fields.description: Parameter controlling the deterministic trend polynomial.Can be specified as a string where c indicates a constant (i.e. a degree zero component of the trend polynomial), t indicates a linear trend with time, and ct is both. Can also be specified as an iterable defining the non-zero polynomial exponents to include, in increasing order.

fields.name: optim_score
fields.title: OptimScore
fields.description: The method by which the score vector is calculated. like harvey, approx

fields.name: optim_hessian
fields.title: Optim Hessian
fields.description: The method by which the Hessian is numerically approximated. opg, oim & approx
